paper_metadata.title: Messaging Experiment for Forsa Poverty Graduation Program

program_information.program_name_citation: The intervention is a video message produced by the Ministry of Social Solidarity (MoSS) providing information relevant to households' decision to participate in the Forsa poverty graduation program.
program_information.country_citation: Through the Forsa program, eligible households are able to receive either a large one-time asset transfer via the self-employment modality, or job matching and skills training via the wage employment modality. The objective of the program is to increase economic self-reliance and resilience among vulnerable households and, in doing so, reduce dependence on the national cash transfer program Takaful.
program_information.target_population_citation: The objective of the program is to increase economic self-reliance and resilience among vulnerable households and, in doing so, reduce dependence on the national cash transfer program Takaful.

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Takaful beneficiaries who join Forsa will continue to receive cash transfers for at least 6 months

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: Through the Forsa program, eligible households are able to receive either a large one-time asset transfer via the self-employment modality, or job matching and skills training via the wage employment modality

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The two primary outcomes measure interest in the Forsa program... Secondary outcomes include beliefs about the implementation of Forsa and its relationship to Takaful.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We implement a stratified randomized controlled trial (RCT) to identify the causal effect of new messaging strategies on interest in joining and recommending the Forsa program.
